SnowReport.Report:
2/19 6AM- Rise and shine! The snow is expected to fall around midday, so keep on snow dancing, flip your PJs inside out, and put that spoon in the freezer, because we are expecting to receive 6-10 inches of snow. For your Friday, we have 99 open trails for you to take turns down, with 65 of those trails starting the day with fresh stripes. 12 lifts are set to spin at 8:30 AM with possible delays. Plus, early access will be available for First Tracks pass holders at 7:45AM. Have fun, play safe, and I’ll definitely be skiing you out there! 

The Gondola will remain closed on Friday, February 20, due to a mechanical issue. Our Lift Maintenance team is awaiting a replacement part required for repair. As this lift is one of a kind in North America, sourcing the necessary component requires additional coordination. This is not a standard stock item and must be specially sourced. We appreciate your patience as we work around the clock to secure the part and restore operations safely and as quickly as possible. 

Betwixt is now open with 19 features ready to ride and more on the way!  This past week, snowmakers laid down a solid foundation while the Parks Crew works day in and day out shaping, prepping, and dialing in features. Go check it out!

Safety Tip: Be aware that you may encounter snowmobiles or heavy machinery on the mountain

Presidents’ Week is here at Stratton, with a full week of skiing, events, and après across the mountain. Starting Saturday, February 14, through Sunday, February 22, lifts spin daily at 8:30AM along with live music, snowshoe hikes, snowcat dinners, and activities happening throughout the week. Off the slopes, enjoy tubing, cross-country skiing, ice skating, and more, while the Village comes alive with dining, shopping, and entertainment. It’s one of the most exciting weeks of the season, and a perfect time to be at Stratton. Hope to see you here!

With conditions lining up this well, it’s a good time to take advantage of a few extra perks. We’re offering lift tickets up to 50% off every Wednesday and Thursday this season—excluding President’s Week.

Reliable cars are the name of the game; that is why we trust Oliver Subaru and Ford. Made for all seasons and all families, check out Oliver Ford and Oliver Subaru for year-round reliability!

Stay and relish the Green Mountains! Stratton Real Estate is here to help with all your real estate needs. Make your sweet escape a reality.
SnowReport.Alert: The Gondola will remain closed on Friday, February 20, due to a mechanical issue.

Forecast.DayComments: Snow before 5pm, then snow and sleet. The snow could be heavy at times.  High near 32. Calm wind becoming southeast around 5 mph in the afternoon.  Chance of precipitation is 100%. Total daytime snow and sleet accumulation of 2 to 4 inches possible.
Forecast.NightComments: Snow, freezing rain, and sleet, becoming all snow after 9pm. The snow could be heavy at times.  Low around 26. Southeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm  in the evening.  Chance of precipitation is 100%. Little or no ice accumulation expected.  New snow and sleet accumulation of 3 to 7 inches possible.
